page.title: 05Tourism in Woburn 3
page.content: {The Heritage Centre} tells the story of the development of Woburn from a Saxon foundation to the establishment of a Cistercian Abbey. The{Russell family became linked with Woburn after the dissolution of the monasteries when Henry V111 gave them land in Norfolk, Devon and Bedfordshire. The centre concentrates on the great days of{coaching}when Woburn's population was 3000, 24 coaches arrived day and night and there was stabling for 100 horses in one Inn alone.Woburn was an important crossroads, being one days journey from Oxford, Cambridge and Leicester.The Post Office was open 24 hours per day. A priceless collection of {Birds' Eggs}is also displayed. Local boys were chosen as bird boys on the Bedford estates if they won a competition set by the Duchess.{ {Pillow Lace }is also shown.
